text: the position is that Parliament has
voted on Trident the existing party
policy was for renewal as you very well
know I am NOT a supporter of nuclear
weapons and we are supporting the UN and
its ban process and cloud will be
continuing the defence review yesterday
though Clive Lewis your defence
spokesman said it was settled and that
you should stop picking at the scab to
use his phrase the parties made its
decision hunter
well anyone's entitled to raise an
opinion on it and they will in the
future I'm sure there are many people
that are going to become increasingly
concerned is not talking about me I'm
not even talking about Labour Party
members or members of CND talking about
people in the military in the Treasury
are very concerned about the cost of
this and the government hasn't set out
its costs on it at all so I got a
feeling the government's going to be
coming back to Parliament with saying
there are some problems here about the
cost of this but you say consistently
that you want the party to be more
democratic you want to listen to the
party more the party's made its
democratic decision do you accept that
that is the party policy because it
sounds like you don't of course I know
what the party policy is and of course I
understand the decision that was taken
does it mean there are people in the
party who have a moral objection to
nuclear weapons yes there are but after
say the party is very United on the idea
that we would be a serious participant
in the UN legal ban process which of
course takes us beyond the
non-proliferation treaty because it
includes those countries that are not
members of systems such as India
Pakistan Israel and North Korea you
sound very determined to bring this
issue back to the party I want to see a
nuclear-free world I want us to make up
our case for that and our participation
in that and that's why Clive will be
going to the band conference given that
it is though currently the party's
policy despite some attempts to overturn
it do you still stand by what you told
us last year that if you were Prime
Minister you would never use the
deterrent I never want to use a nuclear
weapon
